author: Nathalie d'Orleans
text:
RE My 2000 USD dress got stolen or lost by Vestiaire Collective staff in Crawley.

Even after giving evidence that the parcel is dropped at their center and the receptionist signed off on it. They still claim the courrier lost it...

Don't send your items to them better use EBAY or other websites. VC customer service is terrible. They don't reply back in time. Closed their phone number, no live agents basically they loose your items and then thats it.

See below my letter to them, which they ignore 



Dear Support,


Regarding the status for item Lace mid-length dress Dolce & Gabbana (réf. 210166**) that you (Pinky) claims was never sent.



On the 3th of March VC sent me a shipping label (GBR 807 6-00)

On the 6th of March at 11AM, I dropped off a dress at Hermes with a shipping Label that was sent to me on 3 March. (Hermes Code P94661**)

On Wednesday 9th of March 18:32 the dress was delivered by Hermes at Crawley VC center, signed off by the receptionist. See attached confirmation on Hermes courrier website with the code P94661**. The parcel number barcode is T01Y5A00004430** and clearly refers to VC Crawley with shipping label (GBR 807 6-00)

There is evidence from Hermes that it was dropped off and received by your receptionist especially as parcels are tracked with barcodes. It is therefore rubbish to say the parcel was never sent or lost in the mail. Feel free to check on Hermes website and you can clearly see it was delivered and signed off by VC reception.

It seems VC Crawley lost my 2000 USD dress. There are some reports online that staff at VC are stealing items but that is not my issue. You have my dress and lost it. 

I am particularly very upset that you claim your clients lost it or Hermes did, which are un based hurtful allegations which are very bad for your business and trust in Vestiaire Collective. Your company should be trustworthy as you store many expensive items from clients and if VC employees are stealing, send items that are a massive breach of trust. I will never use your company's services anymore and if you don't pay me back. I will ask my social media to publish these details online which will cost you many clients.


If someone at VC is contacting me again please make sure its management as sorting these minor issues is taking weeks and I am not used to people taking me for an idiot saying items are not sent or lost when the evidence is there.


See attached all confirmations.


I await your reply and payment.


BR
title: RE My 2000 USD dress got stolen or lost…

author: Zara Egan
text: I ordered 3 things from VC in one go. Two of them were cancelled for no reason, despite the 2nd item's owners contacting me directly to say she had dropped it at the collection centre. Now it seems to have gone missing. In addition, for the first cancelled item I've received 3 emails with a different amount of the refund on each! They are all over the place and I'm sorry I didn't check Trust pilot before ordering anything :( Items with direct shipping seem to be ok but I wouldn't risk anything worth decent money.
title: Seems to be dodgy

author: Guy Fagot
text:
Yesterday, I stumbled upon their website through a google search for a jacket I want. I registered on their website, and initiated a chat. Without even having typed a single word, in chat, I was banned from chat, for "breach of their terms of service".

Second. Their description of the jacket says "never worn", while the google thumbnail and its description say "used".

I wanted to have certainty about the jacket's condition, so I had a chat session about this with Jerald. This is a different chatline from the one I was banned from (the chat I was banned from is a chat line with the owner of the jacket, if I understood correctly). Jerald told me that, in order to determine if the jacket is new, or used, I have to buy it, pay for it, so that it then is sent to their warehouse for inspection. Which is ridiculous, all the more since the item description on their webpage includes that "it has been verified and authenticated by their experts".

After all this, earlier today, I noticed, which I didn't before, that the photo clearly shows creases at the elbow, proving that it HAS been worn, and is not "never worn". So google was correct, and the "verification and authentication by their experts" a dodgy affair.

I made a substantial offer on that jacket prior to noticing this, but there's of course no way I'm going to pay the amount I offered for a second hand jacket.
title: I stumbled upon their website through a…

author: Louise Payne
text:
I am awaiting a refund for goods paid for on 25th February 2022 , lost by Hermes on 2nd March and despite numerous emails from Vestiaire & me replying asking for a refund - nothing.  As the customer I should not have to wait while they sort this out, I should be reimbursed immediately.  

I have used Vestiaire on many occasions previously but I will not be using them again.  I am very dissatisfied with their customer service.  No one rings you & there are no numbers to call just emails.  I had to write a letter about what had happened, send my ID, they don’t make it easy.  

It has been weeks now & nothing,  if this was a really expensive item I would be very very annoyed.  

I would say to anyone going to use this site to be aware of the problems if the goods go missing.

author: Kate Evans
text:
Please be aware that if you buy anything on Vestiaire and it is lost in transit, Vestiaire require you as the buyer to take part in an investigation that includes a sworn statement that you do not have the item (regardless of the fact that tracking states clearly it is not with you), giving all of your personal details including id documents to aid in their 'investigation'. I'm not sure what the seller has to do but as I buyer surely you are protected by Vestiaire, and with such clear evidence of non receipt. Here are their requirements.....
A sworn statement, in which you clearly state that you have not received your package. Please include the following information in the statement:
The date
Your full name
The delivery address
Your item's tracking number
Your Signature
A photo or scan of a valid ID.

In the meanwhile, Vestiaire will hang onto your money, so no goods, no money and you're the one doing the sworn statement for an item that shows on the carriers site as still in the parcel shop after three weeks.
Despite promises from Vestiaire, I still had to get PayPal involved. PayPal refunded me.
title: If it get's lost, it's down to you, the buyer

text:
